topics.body:
Since sideward and me are talking about miia; yeah, I'm totally excited for July cause objectively I think the anime is going to be super popular.

Why?
For 2015 for the large scale line up of harem anime most of them have flopped popularity wise.
Why are so many of them flopping?  Cause most of them have been removing the harem aspect, removing the adult aspects, removing the romance and needlessly cramming in action into it for the sake of appealing to the lowest common denominator.
Before someone goes "you just hate action!"; no rather what I'm saying is that the problem right now for harem anime in general is that they've been giving the middle finger to their consumer bases and as a result not going anywhere.

To put it another way: Daily life with monster girl is probably going to be a super popular anime because 95% of other harem anime have been giving the fans the middle finger.

Tl:dr; if you want your anime to be popular don't metaphorically give your fans the middle finger.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
